Questions: Choose the correct statement - The number of standard deviations that fit between the mean and the specification limits________
A: Are the same as the Sigma level for the process
B: Decrease with increase in standard deviation

Questions: Which if the following statements in NOT True
A: Standard Deviation decreases as variation in process decreases
B: Sigma Level decreases with the increase in standard deviation
C: Sigma Level decreases with increase in defects
D: Sigma Level is independent of the variation in a process

Questions: Getting every 15th airline passenger checking in to fill in a survey is an example of:
The main reason/s of drawing a sample rather than working with population data is/are:
A: A sample is less time consuming

Questions: Which of the following statements is correct about Continuous and Attribute Data
A: Continuous data shows the spread of the data whereas Attribute data does not
B: Continuous Data does not allow any early warning signs and one gets to know only when the defect has occurred
C: Continuous Data, if collected very infrequently, becomes attribute data
D: Attribute Data provides more information than continuous data

Questions: For the following data set, which measure of central tendency will you prefer using – 2, 2, 3, 6, 7, 7, 8, 93
If the variance of a data set is 25 and the range is 9, what is the standard deviation
Which of the following measures of spread considers each data point:
In a perfect normal distribution, which of the following is true:
A: 95.45% of the data lies inside +/-2 sigma limits
B: 1% of the data lies outside +/- 1 sigma limit
C: 95% of the data lies within +/- 3 sigma limits

Which of the following are examples of continuous data:
I. Height of women
II. Call Resolution Time in a Contact Center
III. Number of Scratches on the screen of a mobile phone
IV. Data is continuous or discrete it depends on how it is being measured and not on the metric
The three critical measures (often together referred to as CTQs) related to Customer or Process Requirements are:
A: Critical to Customer, Critical to Business, Critical to Specification Limits
B: Critical to Quality, Critical to Cost, Critical to Delivery
C: Cost of Poor Quality, Critical to Quality, Critical to Cost

Questions: A hospital form has 2 mandatory fields; 1000 forms are checked for errors and 50 defects are found. Which is the most appropriate method for Sigma Level calculation?
Which of the following statements is NOT true about Attribute Data:
A: Attribute Data can be changed into Continuous Data, whenever required
B: Attribute Data cannot be made continuous even if measured at regular intervals
C: Attribute data can be counted, ranked or sorted but not added, subtracted or averaged
D: describes a named attribute of a process

Questions: Select the logical sequence of various steps followed in the Measure phase of a DMAIC project.
A: Writing the Operational Definition - Measuring Baseline Capability – Measurement System Analysis - Developing a Data Collection Plan
B: Writing the Operational Definition – Developing a Data Collection Plan - Measurement System Analysis - Measuring Baseline Capability
C: Developing a Data Collection Plan - Measuring Baseline Capability – Measurement System Analysis - Writing the Operational Definition

Questions: VOC- Room is too hot. If the temperature is more than 24, it will be hot and less than 18 will be too cold. Why can we not keep it at 21? What is the LSL, USL and the Target?
In context of Measurement System Analysis, which of the following statements is NOT true:
A: Measurement System Variation can be caused by Variation due to Operator or Variation due to Gage
B: Measurement System Variation should be as large as possible
C: Measurement System Variation should be as low as possible
D: Variation due to Gage could be classified as accuracy error, precision error, stability error or linearity error

Questions: In an inspection of 200 projectors, 5 defects are found in 100 projectors and 100 projectors have no defects. What is the DPU and Zlt?
Which of the following statements about the Process Capability and performance Indices is NOT true:
A: Cpk is always higher than Ppk
B: Pp can be greater than or equal to Ppk
C: Cp can be greater than or equal to Cpk
D: Ppk is always higher than Cpk

Questions: What is the Rolled Throughput Yield for the following process – 100 candidates apply for a job, out of which 75 clear the written test. Out of the 75, 50 clear the interview, all 50 are given the job offer. 35 candidates join.

I. It ensures common, clear and consistent understanding of a measure
II. It provides an air tight definition of a variable
III. It translates general understanding of a variable to specific
500 projectors were inspected for 5 characteristics each. 150 defects were observed. What is the estimated short term sigma level
Cpk=0 means
A: The process center has moved to one of the specification limits
D: The process cannot be improved any further

Questions: Estimate the sigma level for a process which has Specification Width twice as much as the Process Width
Which of the following statements about NOT NORMAL data is true:
B: It may not an output of a well-controlled or a natural process
C: It should never be used for further analysis

Questions: Which of the following statements is NOT True about Measurement System Analysis
A: The project cannot move forward unless the Measurement System is acceptable
B: If the Measurement System is not acceptable, we can move to the next phase and not share the Measurement System Analysis with the stakeholders
C: Measurement System Analysis is performed more than once in a DMAIC lifecycle
D: Measurement System Analysis is best done without prior intimation to the operators

Questions: Which of the following is not an objective of the Measure phase:
A: Finalizing Performance Standards for CTQ Y

Questions: Attribute Agreement Analysis is:
A: Generally used when the data is discrete
C: Generally used when the data is continuous
D: Not possible in the absence of a standard score

Questions: Which of the following statements is NOT true:
A: As variation increases, Sigma Level decreases
B: As the mean moves closer to the center of the specification limits, the Sigma Level increases
C: As the number of defects increase, the Sigma Level decreases
D: Variation and mean do not impact the Sigma Level of a process

A: What we have designed it to be
B: What we would like it to be

i) Mean is in control

Upper Specification Limits (USL) and Lower Specification Limits (LSL) are derived from:
A process has an Cpk = 0.85. How would you characterize the capability of this process?
A process has a Cpk = 0.7 and Cp = 2.0. What would be your strategy to improve this process?
D: Both adjust mean and reduce variation

Questions: A process is currently operating at an average value of 22 with a standard deviation of 1.0. The USL for the process is 24 and the LSL is 18. What is the process capability index (Cpk) for this process?

A process has a short-term Sigma Level of 1.5, what is the expected long-term Sigma Level for this process?
A process has a Cpk = 1.87 and Ppk = 1.78. What can you conclude for this process?
A: Process capability is poor and process control is poor
B: Process capability is poor but process control is good
C: Process capability is good and process control is poor
D: Process capability is good and process control is good

What is the PPM Defective for the best possible process in the world
The primary metirc of a DMAIC project is to Increase the Production per day. Which of the following can be a "Consequential metric" in this project :
B: No. of units produced in a day
